items.title: Top End national park under threat from near-invisible invader
items.description: Much-loved by locals and bringing in more than 250,000 visitors a year, Litchfield National Park has become one of the Northern Territory's star attractions. But it's under threat from a rampant new species.

items.title: Boddington locals urged to 'leave immediately' as bushfire fast approaching
items.description: Several bushfires burning north and south of Perth have caused major power blackouts, including the entire town of Margaret River.

items.title: King praises acts of 'spontaneous bravery' in Christmas message
items.description: King Charles III pays homage to those who confronted terror at the Bondi Beach massacre, acknowledging their "spontaneous acts of bravery" in his annual Christmas message.

items.title: Your guide to the 2025 Sydney to Hobart yacht race
items.description: Black sails, a tiny cannon, no prize money — everything you need to know about the Sydney to Hobart yacht race, ahead of its 80th edition, starting today.

items.title: Australia opts for all-pace bowling attack for Boxing Day Test
items.description: With up to 10mm of grass on the MCG pitch, Australia has opted for a bold and historic option and left out offspinner Todd Murphy.

items.title: 'They were a band of brothers': The largely untold story of Australia's first touring cricket team
items.description: They travelled on horse and cart and were smuggled on a boat for three months to England, the story of the First XI Aboriginal cricket team is being remembered as a descendant presents the Boxing Day medal.

items.title: Public assemblies banned for 14 days across Sydney as police enact new laws
items.description: The NSW Police Commissioner, Mal Lanyon, has activated new powers prescribed under changes to NSW protest laws sparked by the terrorist attack at Bondi Beach on December 14.

items.title: Pope Leo asks people to think about Gaza during Christmas Day speech
items.description: During his Urbi et Orbi (city and world) speech on Christmas Day, Pope Leo XIV has called for an end to all wars and for people to think about the conditions in Gaza.

items.title: For these elite runners, pregnancy was once 'treated as an injury'
items.description: For decades, pregnancy was seen as an "injury" that could end a career. But now, determination and growing industry support are seeing marathon-running mothers reach new heights after giving birth.

items.title: Crane collapses, thousands in south-east Qld lose power on Christmas Day
items.description: Storms hit south-east Queensland on Christmas Day afternoon, knocking out power to thousands of homes.

items.title: Social media can help save lives during cyclones, but also spread false rumours
items.description: State government reports have found that while social media plays a vital role in warning communities during tropical cyclones, some posts can lack context and spread misinformation.

items.title: Scientists on 'high alert' as bird flu threat looms over Australian Antarctic Territory
items.description: Preparations are underway for the arrival of the deadly H5 strain of bird flu in the Australian Antarctic Territory, as scientists gather baseline population data so they can measure potential deaths among wildlife.

items.title: Virtuosos to video games: The top classical music and jazz stories of 2025
items.description: From homegrown heroes to visiting legends, here are Australia's favourite classical music and jazz stories this year.

items.title: Kamahl reflects on his life and career
items.description: At 91, Malaysian-born Australian entertainment legend Kamahl reflects on his life and career.

items.title: From Spongebob to Orwell: Your guide to Boxing Day movies
items.description: The soaring mercury has you craving the cool, dark sanctuary of the cinema. But what to see? The art-house awards-season hopeful? The psychological book adaptation? The one with the big snake?

items.title: Before Harry fled the royals there was Edward, who traded his title for love
items.description: Before Harry fled the Royals for Meghan and Montecito, this would-be King of England was famous for trading his title for love. And the cracks began to show on a trip to Australia.

items.title: The Boxing Day deal that set in motion sport's most infamous curse
items.description: It was the deal that changed the face of baseball for good, and set in motion the most infamous sporting curse of all.

items.title: White House official says US forces to focus on 'quarantine' of Venezuela
items.description: The White House has ordered US military forces to focus almost exclusively on enforcing the "quarantine" of Venezuelan oil, a US official says.

items.title: A million more Epstein files found, US government says
items.description: The Department of Justice says the release of the Epstein files will take "a few more weeks" after a million additional documents were uncovered.

items.title: Regional Victorian cricket clubs are batting above average for female participation
items.description: More women of all ages are signing up to play cricket in regional Victoria.

items.title: 'Aussie' poster in Adelaide vandalised with 'white power' graffiti
items.description: An Adelaide street artist's poster aimed at provoking thought about national identity has been vandalised with racist graffiti.

items.title: SA Labor stalwart and former federal minister Nick Bolkus dies
items.description: Nick Bolkus, the long-time Labor senator who played an influential role in shaping Australia's migration policy under prime minister Paul Keating, has died aged 75.

items.title: This couple is on opposite sides of the political divide. Here's how they make it work
items.description: More Australian relationships are struggling because of political divides. But experts say this does not have to be the end.

items.title: 'We push it to the max': She ready to add to Sydney to Hobart history
items.description: A fellowship of sailors will embark on She's 23rd Sydney to Hobart campaign. As they do they will honour one of the most resilient boats in the race's history and remember late owner Peter Rodgers.

items.title: PM, Jewish leaders condemn apparent firebombing of Hanukkah car
items.description: Authorities were called to a St Kilda East residence about 3am, where a car with a sign celebrating the Jewish holiday had been set alight.
